conclusion: Violation of Art. 6-1;Preliminary objection rejected;Just satisfaction reserved
docname: CASE OF HORNSBY v. GREECE - [Russian Translation]
issue: Constitution, 1975, Article 95 para. 5 ; Criminal Code, Article 259 ; Civil Code, Articles 57 and 59 ; Introductory Law to the Civil Code (Law no. 2783/41), sections 104 and 105 ; Presidential Decree no. 18/1989 codifying the legislative provisions on the Supreme Administrative Court, sections 45 and 50 ; Presidential decree no. 211/1994 of 10 August 1994 on "bringing Greek legislation concerning the setting up and running of frontistiria ... into conformity with Articles 7, 48, 52, 58 and 59 of the Treaty instituting the European Economic Community", sections 1 and 2 ; Law no. 1566/1985, section 14 (10) ; Law no. 2545/1940 on private schools, frontistiria and boarding-schools, sections 63 and 68
scl: Golder v. the United Kingdom judgment of 21 February 1975, Series A no. 18, pp. 16-18, paras. 34-36;Philis v. Greece judgment of 27 August 1991, Series A no. 209, p. 20, para. 59;Van de Hurk v. the Netherlands judgment of 19 April 1994, Series A no. 288;Di Pede v. Italy judgment of 26 September 1996, Reports of Judgments and Decisions 1996-IV, pp. 1383-1384, paras. 20-24;Zappia v. Italy judgment of 26 September 1996, Reports of Judgments and Decisions 1996-IV, pp. 1410-1411, paras. 16-20
